intro: Baumea riparia, commonly known as the river rush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as riverbanks and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its slender, grass-like leaves are usually green, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Baumea riparia plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
